thread.title: Barnsley’s clash with Leeds United saw fans fighting in stands at Oakwell in the Championship
thread.title_full: Barnsley’s clash with Leeds United saw fans fighting in stands at Oakwell in the Championship

author: gboulton
title: Barnsley’s clash with Leeds United saw fans fighting in stands at Oakwell in the Championship
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments UGLY scenes of fans fighting at Oakwell have emerged as Barnsley came out on top in a five-goal thriller over Leeds United in the Championship. 
Video footage has emerged of punches being thrown and threats being made as police failed to control supporters at the Yorkshire derby. Barnsley and Leeds United fans fight in the stands during Championship match 
It is unclear which set of supporters are involved in the violence and what area of the stadium the fighting broke out as tempers flared at the Championship clash. 
Leeds United took the lead through Chris Wood but the hosts came back from behind and scored three goals in nine minutes to win 3-2 . Rex Features Leeds midfielder Pablo Hernandez is pictured as carnage broke out behind him Rex Features The chaos sees fans and stewards confront one another at Oakwell Related Stories All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window CHINA WANT ROO Man Utd captain Wayne Rooney being lined up by Chinese Super League in stunning £1m A WEEK deal PAT PLAN Sunderland want Arsenal legend Patrick Vieira to take over from David Moyes if Scot is fired or quits KEANE INTEREST Manchester City join Everton and Leicester in race to sign £20m Burnley defender Michael Keane off the mark Liverpool flop Lazar Markovic set to be sent back to Anfield from loan spell at Sporting Lisbon DONNA DEMANDS Prem clubs on red alert as agent Mino Raiola demands AC Milan pay £165,000-a-week for Gianluigi Donnarumma Jose wants Mour Antoine Griezmann, Bernardo Silva and Kieran Tierney: Jose Mourinho's top five Man United targets Andros Toonsend Palace winger Andros Townsend wants to return to Newcastle just six months after they sold him Barnsley and Leeds United fans clash in the corner of the stadium during tense match 
Tom Bradshaw equalised for Barnsley before the break and Ryan Kent, on loan from Liverpool, gave them the lead after swivelling before firing a striker into the far bottom corner. 
Then a terrific free kick from Conor Hourihane gave the hosts a two goal lead which halved after Wood converted from the spot following a hand ball. PA:Press Association
